phrases: yume kanaeru made chousen wa tsuzuku
juunengo no mirai kagayaiteru sugata wa
koukai wa shinai jibun de egaita story
makenai to i am about to mune ni chikatta
yume no tochuu de meguriau deai to wakare
kimi ga oshietekureta boku dake ga motsu chikara
This is an extremely rare human-faced otter!
The next serialization committee is the real deal!
You are going to put everything you have learned so far into your next work!
But just what kind of manga should they make?
There is no guarantees with manga, but there should be something only you can do.
And if you can pull it off, it will not lose, not even to Niizuma.
But can we draw that manga?
We have not even been a match for him so far...
First off, did you enjoy making your last manga, STOPPER OF MAGMA?
I feel bad saying this in front of Miura, but not really.
I did not really like it, either...
I guess if the authors are not into it, it will not be a good manga.
But I agree with the editorial department's decision to deny KTM a serialization.
Rankings based on the interaction between the two.
Considering all that, a protagonist who spends all his time trying to raise his rankings is not appealing.
You are trying to move the story forward by the strength of its setting alone.
So that is why you had us make a mainstream fantasy after that?
With as simple of a setting as possible.
Yes, but there was another reason for that.
I do not understand that bit.
You wanted them to make a humorous fantasy, right?
This is something I wanted the three of you to realize,
but perhaps it would have been easier to understand if I had said to make an unconventional manga with humor in it.
Listen, there is absolutely no humor in this manga.
You could say the same about +NATURAL.
I do not think serious stories need humor.
That is because you are thinking about putting in silly things to make people laugh.
When I read Tanto, I could not help feeling that it was a waste.
I thought there should be a more effective use for Takagi's humor.
Ashirogi Muto's defining characteristic is definitely unconventional stories.
What you should aim for is...
Er, I do not get it at all.
Do you remember the human-faced rescue chapter of Otters 11 ?
This is a rare human-faced otter!
When the TV crew captured Otter 11's friend, the human-faced otter,
they made a spectacle of him, and Otter 11 got angry.
He smashed a truck into the TV station building and ran to save him.
Do you think Hiramaru was trying to get laughs with that scene?
No, I think it is drawn seriously.
Making people laugh without trying to make them laugh.
The kind of humor that can only be done in a serious story.
It would be amazing if you could do that deliberately!
And I think you are the only one who can do that.
The more serious the art, the more what we are trying to do will shine.
It will because a chemical reaction!
We have got to do it.
He thought of something that really suits them...
Did you pair up Akina Aiko and Niizuma for Natural...
and make that speech at the wedding...
just to bring us to this point?
You are reading too much into it.
KTM, STOPPER OF MAGMA, and Tanto.
Listen, nothing you did so far has been in vain!
The three of you together can definitely make a great manga!
This is all the advice I can give you.
I cannot wait to read it.
Let Us get started with the meeting!
You have already seen the promo a bunch of times.
I want to see it in real time.
Besides, since I have got an anime, I can take a break for a week or two...
So you can take a break, can you?
Then I will take an eternal break from This week's Aoki Kou.
So without further ado, This week's Aoki Kou!
That is it for this week?
What do you mean by that?
What if you go out to tea with Aoki?
Then you can order Earl Grey for her!
She will definitely think better of you.
Please tell me more about Aoki next week, too.
Luckily, Aoki's editor is my subordinate.
I have to decide the setting pretty soon.
Hattori went out of his way to give us advice.
I want to live up to his expectations.
Even though we have a clear direction...
No, because we have a clear direction, I want to really nail the setting.
Since we are here, let us enjoy the school festival!
There is no octopus in here!
This is not a manga, so that could not...
This kind of surprise makes me happy.
It is just more octopus than usual.
I am going to a meeting.
What is going on with Ashirogi's storyboard?
I told you to show it to me soon!
The Chief may have said he would not allow them to draw for Jack any more, but he is not really going to enforce it...
No, he is serious about it.
If he allows them to continue being selfish, it will be a bad example for the other authors.
Serious humor... it is more difficult than using silly stuff to get laughs.
Thinking of a setting is difficult, too.
I think something just needs to come to me.
Um, just in case you do not have a flash of inspiration,
do not you think you should touch up KTM's setting and make a storyboard from that?
No, I do not think we can do serious humor with KTM.
If anything, it would have been TRAP...
Like a criminal caught in a trap, or something.
Like that I did not expect that!
That line of thinking's pretty good!
I did not expect that!, huh?
But putting in an I did not expect that!
moment would be trying to make them laugh.
I think serious humor is something else.
I heard that their storyboard was not considered at the last serialization committee.
But they are already working hard on their next manga.
Well, they seem kind of desperate, though.
This is their last chance, after all.
What do you mean by last chance?
I am sorry, I may have said too much.
No, please tell me the details.
It cannot be... if they do not pass at the next committee,
they cannot draw for Jack anymore?
I have not heard about it from Mashiro.
Apparently, it was their condition for quitting Tanto.
I can understand why Akito did not tell me, but...
Let us just silently watch over them for now.
Let us believe in them, okay?
I thought I put it in here...
Why did we have to come all the way to Hattori's apartment to ask him for advice?
Who said we were asking him for advice?
We are going to tail Hattori all day today.
I do not really know myself.
We are tailing him without knowing why?
Well, I do not know, but... you know how Hattori always helps us out?
But this time, I felt like we were being manipulated.
So if we tail him for a day, I feel like I can come up with an idea!
And we will get him back at the same time!
I thought he would not leave until past noon.
This reminds me of the time we staked out Azuki's house in middle school.
We were pretty young back then.
He is going to work, I guess.
I think so too, but let us get on the train car next to his without him noticing.
Let us get something to eat.
Shujin, you are not just playing around, are you?
Seems like he is in a good mood.
That is Ibaraki from Jack SQ.
He is in an even better mood.
Let us say hi to him!
No, that would make this whole thing pointless!
Just what are we trying to do here?
We are not going to do anything, but we are tailing him in secret.
He is really into whatever he is reading.
Oh, he is going to buy it!
I am going to go take a look!
Do not let him notice you.
Key Points of Women in Love?
Also, Basic Manners for Relationships and The Art of Taking the Initiative in Love.
Crap, this tailing thing just got fun.
But are not we sitting too close to him?
My heart's pounding in my ears.
If we do not sit this close, we will not hear what he says.
You are wearing sunglasses, so it should be oka
That voice... it is Iwase, is not it?
But she is dressed up really nicely.
And she is wearing more makeup than at the New Years party.
I read the storyboard you sent me.
It was good, for the most part.
I marked the spots that need fixing.
Rather than pretty, I would say that your youth is dazzling.
N-Now, let us get back to the
Will you take me out to a movie on your next day off?
Let us wait outside till he is done.
Strange, they both have their phones turned off.
I want those two to go for it.
There have not been any newcomers aiming for the top lately.
But those two have that kind of ambition.
Since the time they first consulted with me,
I felt their drive and ambition.
I felt it from their manuscript, as well.
Ashirogi Muto will become great authors, for sure.
I want to bet on them.
I am sorry I got chosen as their editor.
It does not matter who their editor is.
My judgment as an editor was correct.
Maybe that is all I wanted to prove.
Hattori, Miura, let us drink up tonight!
And he gets home a little before 3 AM.
Instead of getting back at him, we were kind of encouraged by him.
Yeah, I am fired up now.
Actually, we have to wait at a restaurant till the first train.
So what was today all about?
Did not anything occur to you?
We had that I did not expect that!
I got caught up in that.
So from that, and from trailing Hattori, I know what we are going to do now.
What kind of manga can you make from trailing and I did not expect that!?
it is a perfect crime manga.
The protagonist is a boy who admires and is fascinated by perfect crimes.
But he does not commit real crimes.
For example, he observes the pencil case of the boy who sits next to him.
What kind of case it is, what condition it is in...
How many pencils are in it, what kind of pencils, how long they are,
how worn down the erasers are...
Then he creates a perfect replica and exchanges them without anyone noticing.
And he is satisfied when the boy does not notice a difference.
That is the I did not expect that! bit.
Even if it is not a real crime!
What kind of splendid crime will he pull off?
Even if it is stupid at first glance, the more serious you treat it, the funnier it is!
That is where the serious humor will come from.
Swapping a pencil case, or tailing like we did.
It is okay if the protagonist's perfect crimes are all small.
Eventually, he notices others who enjoy doing the same thing.
Some stuff happens, and they end up teaming up.
About three of them will form an underground society at the school... a perfect crime club!
Elementary school kids who commit perfect crimes!
Maybe they match wits with the police and evil organizations,
and use their intelligence to avoid being caught, or something!
Sounds good, we can run with that!
Hey, you should at least tell me when you are going out data collecting.
I am going out the day after tomorrow.
I am bringing her a present, since it is her birthday.
You two will not be going, will you?
I bought her a one piece at Yakusa Hill Town!
She is turning 20, so it is okay to splurge, right?
I took the opportunity to get myself one, too!
I thought of a perfect crime!
Something exactly the same as this?
We cannot tell what store she bought it from by this picture.
We will start by finding it.
We do not know the name of the store.
And how many clothes stores do you think there are here
If this were a manga, it would be...
We do not know which store!
So how are we going to find the store?
We will search one by one.
So you have not thought that far.
Is it okay to let me see your wife's sleeping face?
Even Mashiro is not picking up his phone...
Are they really going to be okay?
It is important to get a taste of what the protagonist is feeling, after all!
The thrill of the crime, and the sense of accomplishment when you pull it off!
Tailing Hattori also came in handy for the storyboard...
My pencil will not stop moving!
This is the best storyboard you have ever done!
Okay then, make a clean copy of this eight page scene!
Do you still have nothing from Ashirogi Muto?!
You know they cannot fail next time, right?!
I will get them to hurry!
Maybe this is as far as Ashirogi Muto goes.
We should not have let them quit Tanto!
Crap, I never got back to him!
Why did not you call me back?
He is asking if you have gotten anything done yet!
It is going to be great!
A hundred times better than KTM!
Since you are turning 20, I went for a more mature look...
Out of all the presents I have gotten, this one makes me the happiest!
I am going to get embarrassed if you say all that...
Did you ask Mashiro to draw this?
But do not you look a little too pretty?
So where is the present I got you?
I wonder if Kaya's dress got there yet.
She will complain about it later.
Is it rude to ask a professional manga author to draw a picture for me every year?
Of course I can, if you would like...
Creating surprises is also part of a perfect crime.
We will use those surprises to shock and amuse the readers!
If there is no octopus, it is a surprise.
If there is too much octopus, it is a surprise.
This manga's going to be great!
Everyone will definitely get excited when they read it!
Hurry and show me the storyboard!
Is this really a hundred times better than KTM?
It is not about yes or no.
It is about whether or not Ashirogi Muto's work can really beat Niizuma's!
Next time on Bakuman: Win and Lose.
Will Ashirogi Muto's dream be broken?

The fight does not end until I fulfill my dream
I wonder how far I have come now?
In ten years, I will be living the dream
It is the scenario I wrote for myself, so I will have no regrets
But life is not that easy, and it is full of obstacles
Still, I swear to myself that I will not ever back down
I have a dream that I absolutely want to achieve
So I fuel my passion until I succeed
There will be meetings and partings along the way
But I will simply believe in my strength that you have taught me
And rise back up again and again and again

The reason I chose to take a detour
was to fall ever deeper in love with you
I have a feeling I have always known
what your voice sounds like when it calls my name
many lines that make up a suspension bridge leading to you
Show me the way I am sure our path
your way connects us without any turns
Show me the way It leads to the place where we promised
Show me the way I will never give up
Show me the way and see that we are certain to meet again
It was interesting, but probably lacks the tension expected from a shounen magazine.
The setting might be too complicated for young people to understand.
Then 80 of students headed off to have fun in the campus etc.
The other 20 remained in their seats
For example, Mari, studying in her seat
